intro: Stenostephanus ericae, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a glossy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
